pullrequest.title: Word-wrapping in treeviews and item views, adapted from David Meyer's implementation.

content.raw:
I definitely support letting go of not worth it issues. The centering one in particular seems very annoying. I’m glad to see changing the inactive highlights fixes the flashing.

Testing that out, I’ve come across some other things that may be new issues. With this change, exiting editing with enter or tab leaves the row highlighted. Do we need to be concerned about un-intuitive behavior with that row highlighted? By that I mean, with a row highlighted, Up/Down arrows moves the highlight; tab moves focus around the GUI at large; enter does nothing; and typing enters editing of the next element in the row \(except for the expansion column where nothing happens except for space which closes the group but keeps it active \[I suspect that is a bug\]\). I’m not sure any of those things would be expected if you just saw a highlighted row.
